intro: Piresia palmula, commonly known as the slender palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, Piresia palmula is considered vulnerable in some areas.
